dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, hey, did you catch the SpaceX news this week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, hey, did you catch the SpaceX news this week?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the [overlaps] *massive* funding round, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the massive funding round, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Massive is an understatement! Like, $850 million, apparently. For Starlink and Starship.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Massive is an understatement! Like, eight hundred fifty million dollars, apparently. For Starlink and Starship.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Billionaire Elon Musks rocket company SpaceX reportedly completed an $850 million fundraising round last week, as it looks to raise capital for its ambitious Starlink and Starship projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Phew, that's a lot of cash. And it bumped their valuation up to, uh, like $74 billion now, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Phew, that's a lot of cash. And it bumped their valuation up to, uh, like seventy four billion dollars now, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News of the funding was first reported by CNBC, which said that the private company will now have a valuation of around $74 billion, citing people familiar with the financing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, crazy. And get this: the shares were sold at $419.99.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, crazy. And get this: the shares were sold at four hundred nineteen dollars and ninety nine cents.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company raised new funds at $419.99 per share, per CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, come on. [chuckles] That's *got* to be an Elon Musk reference to the 420 tweet, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, come on. That's got to be an Elon Musk reference to the four hundred twenty tweet, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! He just can't help himself. But, uh, speaking of Musk, this round apparently boosted his personal stake quite a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! He just can't help himself. But, uh, speaking of Musk, this round apparently boosted his personal stake quite a bit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like his 48% is now worth around $32 billion. Still not enough to, you know, unseat Bezos, though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like his forty eight percent is now worth around thirty two billion dollars. Still not enough to, you know, unseat Bezos, though.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If he managed to hold onto all 48%, his stake would now be worth about $32 billionup from roughly $20 billion previously, according to Forbes estimates. That would boost Musks net worth by $12 billionbut thats still not enough for him to pass Bezos and retake the spot of the richest person on the planet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope, Bezos is still holding strong at the top. But, like, these projects, Starship, that's the reusable rocket, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope, Bezos is still holding strong at the top. But, like, these projects, Starship, that's the reusable rocket, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The aim of the project is to develop a fully-reusable launch vehicle that is expected to take cargo, and eventually passengers, into space at a lower cost than other existing spacecraft.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. The idea is to make space travel way cheaper for cargo, and eventually, um, passengers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. The idea is to make space travel way cheaper for cargo, and eventually, um, passengers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The aim of the project is to develop a fully-reusable launch vehicle that is expected to take cargo, and eventually passengers, into space at a lower cost than other existing spacecraft.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Starlink, that's the satellite internet thing? I heard they're seeing pretty good demand for it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Starlink, that's the satellite internet thing? I heard they're seeing pretty good demand for it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Beyond successfully launching U.S. astronauts into space in May of last year, SpaceX said in 2020 that it was seeing extraordinary demand for its Starlink satellite broadband service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They are, yeah. But, um, there are still some questions about scaling capacity and, like, the actual cost to consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They are, yeah. But, um, there are still some questions about scaling capacity and, like, the actual cost to consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, early tests have shown broadbands speeds capable of playing online video games and streaming movies, but the service faces criticism over its cost and the companys ability to scale capacity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fair enough. Oh, and I saw they also had a secondary transaction. Insiders sold another $750 million in shares.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fair enough. Oh, and I saw they also had a secondary transaction. Insiders sold another seven hundred fifty million dollars in shares.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to raising money for its large-scale projects, SpaceX also completed a secondary transaction in which SpaceX insiders and investors were able to sell an additional $750 million worth of their shares, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a bit of cashing out. Pretty wild week for SpaceX, all things considered.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a bit of cashing out. Pretty wild week for SpaceX, all things considered.
